item.description:
Eating/socializing starts at 1 p.m., Show-and-Tell at 2 p.m.

Hi Everyone - I'm new at this - I've been on raw foods, close to 100%, since mid-April 2012.  Little by little I've been expanding my skills, equipment and repertoire, and would enjoy exchanging philosophy, insights, recipes, techniques, tips and tricks.  I love to learn and share.  Beginners welcome! Join me on June 16th - and if you can, please bring something you've prepared and a kitchen tool to demonstrate - as simple or as elaborate as you like.  I've got a Vitamix, citrus juicer, Cuisinart blender and food processor, a Samson single-augur juicer (does "everything"), a TSM dehydrator, and numerous hand tools we can use.

See you there!

Raw Potluck: all those attending are requested to bring a 100% raw, organic, unprocessed, non-animal based (vegan with no honey) ready-to-serve dish for 9-15 people. Please bring a typed or neatly printed recipe to display next to your dish ideally with copies for people to take with them if they so choose.

The below list of raw vegan food dish ideas to help you have plenty of ideas for dishes to bring to our potluck events.

1. You could bring an organic salad;

2. There is a source for raw recipes listed in the invitation at http://www.rawnewenglandcommunity.com/;

3. There are plenty of raw recipes available online

http://www.living-foods.com/recipes/;

http://goneraw.com/;

http://www.rawsacramento.net/recipes.htm/;

http://www.healthfree.com/raw_food_recipes.html/;

http://www.rawganique.com/recipes.htm/;

http://www.giveittomeraw.com/forum/categories/recipes-1/listForCategory/;

http://www.livinghiho.com/recipes/;

4. Most raw food books have raw recipes; and

5. Organic fruit or fruit salad.
item.how_to_find_us: Red Line to Alewife, 62/76 bus to Locust Ave., or 77 (Mass. Ave. from Harvard Sq.) to last stop, walk towards Trader Joe's and keep going about a mile. If you drive, ample free parking.
item.name: Raw Food Potluck with Show-and-Tell
